required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nitrates and IL-8 in Barrett's Esophagus
clinical_study.official_title: The Association Between Nitrates, Nitrosylated Proteins, and Interleukin-8 in Barrett's Esophagus and Esophageal Adenocarcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if nitrates and IL-8 (which are found in food and throughout the body regulating stomach acidity) play a role in Barrett's Esophagus and/or Esophageal Adenocarcinoma severity and if screening for these biomarkers can help predict patients that are more at risk for developing worsening disease.

primary_outcome.description: Nitrate levels in serum, saliva and tissue in patients with normal squamous epithelium, erosive esophagitis, non-dysplastic BE (NDBE), and BE with high-grade dysplasia (HGD) or EAC
Levels of IL-8 in patients diagnosed BE dysplasia and EAC

secondary_outcome.description: Level of IL-8 in serum and tissue in patients with NDBE that progressed to BE

arm_group.description: Patients found to have grossly normal squamous epithelium during endoscopy
Patients found to have grossly apparent erosive esophagitis >1cm with Los Angeles Classification A-D
Patients with non-dysplastic Barrett's Esophagus (NDBE) > 1cm (Short Segment)
Patients with non-dysplastic Barrett's Esophagus (NDBE) > 1cm (Long Segment)
Barrett's Esophagus (BE) with high-grade dysplasia (HGD) or esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC)
Patients undergoing resection of esophageal cancer
Patients undergoing EGD with NSE, NDBE, BE-HGD, or EAC for feasibility of analytical techniques

study_pop.textblock: Adult individuals scheduled for clinically indicated EGD procedure. Subjects with normal squamous epithelium, erosive esophagitis, or varying degrees of Barrett's Esophagus may be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing a clinicallly-indicated Esophagogastroduoedoscopy (EGD).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Comorbid inflammatory medical condition.
- Use of antiinflammatory (aspirin and NSAIDs) or immunosuppressants over the past 1 week.
- Use of nitrate containing medication in the past 1 week.
- Consumption of nitrate rich foods in preceding 24 hours.
- Known allergy to meat or nitrates
